sentence.Network_en: The book was inspired by a real person, namely Tamara de Treaux.

sentence.Network_cn: 我们须针对我们的听众对象，即年龄在20到30岁之间的妇女。

entry.def: You use namely to introduce detailed information about the subject you are discussing, or a particular aspect of it.

example.ex: One group of people seems to be forgotten, namely pensioners...
example.tran: 有一类人似乎被遗忘了，就是那些领养老金的人。

example.ex: They were hardly aware of the challenge facing them, namely, to re-establish prosperity.
example.tran: 他们几乎没有意识到自己面临的挑战，即再创繁荣。

nick=eke+name[n.名字, 名称, 姓名]→新加的名字→绰号，昵称

sentences.en: Only one boy was absent, namely Harry.
sentences.cn: 只有一个孩子缺席, 就是哈利。

sentences.en: He could not do anything more than what he promised —namely, to look after Charlotte's estate.
sentences.cn: 他只能做到自己答应的事, 那就是照看夏洛蒂的产业。
